Challengetext.GenericMoneyGrant: You have received a cash grant!
Challengetext.CHgrantmoney: Your local city council and animal welfare society want to run a promotion at your zoo granting residents of your community half price admissions. They hope to deliver the message that proper care and feeding is essential to all animals, and that domestic animals deserve the same attention as the exotic animals in your zoo. They have agreed to pay you an upfront fee of $5000. This promotion will last for 6 months as long as your animals remain healthy. If any of your animals become ill, the promotion will end immediately and no further compensation will be received. At the end of the promotion period, if no animals became ill, they will also compensate you for your lost admissions fees.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoneyShort: Run a half price admissions promotion for 6 months.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoneySuccess: The promotion period has ended and the animals in your facility have been receiving excellent care. City council considers the promotion a resounding success and have reimbursed you for the lost admissions during the promotional period.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoneySuccessShort: The promotion was a success and you've been reimbursed for lost admissions!
Challengetext.CHgrantmoneyFailure: Unfortunately animals in your facility have shown signs of illness. City council does not feel that this is representative of the message they wish to deliver and have cancelled the promotion. Your admission prices return to normal however you will not receive any additional funds for lost admissions.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoneyFailureShort: You have failed to maintain healthy animals. The promotion period is now over.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoney2: You've been approached by a venture capitalist who is certain that there is a buck to be made in creating a top notch zoo. He's ready to provide $10000 in funding in exchange for 40% of your profits, up until the point where he has achieved a gain of $2000 over and above his initial investment.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoney2Short: You've accepted a loan and are in the process of repaying it...
Challengetext.CHgrantmoney2Success: Your profitable facility has been able to repay the entire loan extended to you by venture capitalists. you can now enjoy your profits exclusively.
Challengetext.CHgrantmoney2SuccessShort: Your loan has been repaid and your facility is in the clear!
Challengetext.CHBearConference: Bear biologists from around the world are looking for a venue in which to hold a conference to share the latest research and management information about bears. They have agreed to hold their conference at your site and pay you a $2000 site fee as long as you can add another species of Ursidae to your facility. According to the terms they have presented, you must have another species on site within four months and should you fail, you will need to pay them a $3000 cancellation fee.
Challengetext.CHBearConferenceShort: Have two animal species in the family Ursidae to be eligible to host a conference and receive a $2000 fee.
Challengetext.CHBearSuccess: Excellent! Your recent addition of a new bear species to your park meets the requirements of the bear conference. $2000 has been added to your account.
Challengetext.CHBearSuccessShort: Excellent! Your park features two species in the family of Ursidae.
Challengetext.CHBearFailureShort: Your park has failed of obtain two species in the Ursidae family in the required time period.
Challengetext.CHBearFailure: The deadline for adding a new bear species to your park has elapsed and the bear conference has been forced to book another venue. Per the terms of your agreement, $3000 has been deducted from your account.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTrade: The Zoological Cooperative Association (ZCA) is running a feasibility study to determine if member zoos can benefit from a program of trading animals between zoos. Ideally zoos would exchange animals with similar biome requirements however availability won't always accommodate this. As a member, you will exchange one of your animals for a new animal for a temporary 3 month period. It is essential that you keep the animal healthy and achieve a donation income of $500 for your new animal over this period otherwise the venture will be financially unsuccessful. In 3 months you will again swap animals. The study will determine if a regularly rotating exhibit cycle has a positive impact on zoo attendance and cash flow.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeFirstShort: Generate $500 in donations over a 3 month period from the animal on loan to your zoo.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeFirstSuccessShort: Great! The first animal trade proved to be a success.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeFailureShort: Unfortunately you failed to generate enough to indicate that animal swapping is viable. The study has been cancelled.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeFirstSuccess: Excellent! The first 3 months seem to indicate that this venture may provide a successful opportunity for member zoos. One of your animals will be traded for a new animal though again, a matching biome is not guaranteed. Your results will be evaluated in 3 months.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeFailure: Unfortunately this exhibit swap has proven to be financially unfeasible. Without donations of $500, the cost of transport the animals exceeds the results obtained. The ZCA has cancelled the study.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeSecondShort: Generate $500 in donations over a 3 month period from the new animal on loan to your zoo.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeSecondSuccess: The second phase of the ZCA trading venture has been successfully completed. As a final test, the ZCA will conduct one last 3 month term. Once again you must generate $500 in donation income in order to justify the program.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeSecondSuccessShort: Great! Your second animal trade proved to be a success.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeThirdSuccess: The ZCA has completed their study on the benefits of trading animals among member zoos. Your results appear to be very positive and the Association will consider making this a regular benefit available to zoo members.
Challengetext.CHAnimalTradeThirdSuccessShort: Rotating animals among member facilities has been a great success. Your participation was an asset to the study and you have received a cash grant of $7500.
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrike: The National Refuse Collectors (NRCU) union has just voted affirmatively on a strike action! Pending the satisfactory negotiation of a new contract, your maintenance workers have walked off the job. It is expected that the strike action could last up to 1 month. You can pay a high priced strike team $8000 to handle trash cleanup until your maintenance workers return. Alternatively you can choose not to pay their fee and collect and clean the trash in your zoo yourself to avoid unhappy guests. Would you like to hire the strike team?
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrikeShort: Clean your zoo for 1 month until your maintenance workers return.
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrikePayShort: You've hired a strike team to clean your zoo for 1 month until your maintenance workers return.
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrikeSuccessShort: Great! The strike is over and your maintenance workers are back at work.
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrikePaySuccessShort: The strike team handled things successfully while your maintenance workers were on strike.
Challengetext.CHGarbageStrikeSuccess: You've successfully handled the walk-out of your maintenance workers. All has been resolved and they are happy to be back at work.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStress: A national zoo inspection agency has filed a complaint against your facility, citing that animals at your facility have been subjected to "behavioral stress and unnecessary discomfort". They have slapped a 1 month ban on any new animals entering the facility. You can choose to argue their claim, in which case your zoo will be closed to the public for 1 month while they re-inspect the facility for ill or unhappy animals, or you can accept the charge and operate for 1 month without adopting any new animals. If you argue the claim and the animals are not kept in good condition during the inspection period, you will incur a $2500 fine on top of a 1 month restriction on new animals. Do you wish to argue the claim?
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressShort: Your zoo is restricted from adopting new animals for 1 month.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressArgueShort: Your zoo is closed. The condition of your animals will be monitored for 1 month.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressSuccessShort: The restriction on adopting new animals has been lifted.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressArgueSuccessShort: Your animals are in great shape. An apology has been issued and you have received a $5000 payment for unncessary hardship.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressArgueFailureShort: Your animals remain in poor shape. You have been fined $2500 and your zoo is restricted from adopting new animals for 1 month.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressEnd: The inspection agency lifted the ban on animal adoptions. It is hoped that you will maintain an adequate facility as a result of this hardship.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressSuccess: The inspection agency has found no evidence of animal mistreatment and has rescinded their claim against your facility. As compensation for your lost income, they have paid you a one time hardship fee of $5000.
Challengetext.CHAnimalStressArgueFailure: The inspection agency has again found evidence of animal mistreatment and has upgraded your violation status to red. They have imposed a 1 month suspension on your ability to adopt new animals and fined you $2500.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance: You have the opportunity to obtain an animal that has been rescued from an illegally run animal "mill". The species has not been disclosed and your cost will be $1400 to ship the animal to your facility. While it is likely that the animal is in the Lower Risk category, there is also a good chance that it is vulnerable or endangered in which case it would be a valuable acquisition. Your only obligation is to provide a suitable exhibit.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChanceShort: Provide a suitable environment for your new animal.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChanceSuccessShort: Great! Your new animal is at home in its new exhibit.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChanceGreatSuccess: Congratulations! You've made a resourceful decision and have obtained an extraordinary animal at an excellent price.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChanceSuccess: The animal that you have received is indeed in the Lower Risk category. While it is likely that you could have adopted an animal of this species at a lower cost, this animal is much better off in your care and your guests will still enjoy the new addition.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance2: A private "donor" has approached your zoo and would like to make an anonymous transaction. They have an animal available but they refuse to disclose what species. They've implied that it is an endangered species but make no guarantees. They do guarantee that this is a legal transaction. They are offering the animal to you for their cost of $4800.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance2SuccessShort: Great! Your new animal will make a great addition to your zoo.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance2GreatSuccessShort: You have been very fortunate to receive an extraordinary animal.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance2GreatSuccess: Congratulations! You've made a resourceful decision and have obtained an extraordinary animal at an excellent price.
Challengetext.CHRandomAnimalChance2Success: Unfortunately the anonymous donor did not accurately represent the facts. While you have received a healthy animal, it is not in the endangered class as was implied and it is likely that you have overpaid. However the animal is certainly better off in your care than in those of the unscrupulous "donor" and your guests will certainly enjoy your new addition.
Challengetext.CHRaffle: The Health and Husbandry Association, a non-profit organization, is holding a 50/50 raffle and has offered to sell you a block of 10 tickets for $100. Their portion will be used to benefit the health of domestic farm animals nationwide. Would you like to participate in the raffle?
Challengetext.CHRaffleSuccess: Congratulations! You've won the 50/50 raffle! You have received $%s and the Health and Husbandry Association is grateful for your participation.
Challengetext.CHRaffleFailureShort: One of your guests has won the raffle!
Challengetext.CHRaffleFailure: The Health and Husbandry Association has drawn their raffle and one of your guests has won $%s. Your guest is ecstatically happy and the Health and Husbandry Association is very grateful for your participation.
Challengetext.CHAnimalSale: You've been approached by another zoo that is interested in obtaining one of your animals. In exchange they have offered to make a generous donation to your facility. Would you like to release your %s to this facility in exchange for their donation of $%s?
Challengetext.CHAnimalSaleSuccessShort: Your animal is on its way to a new home and you have received a $X donation!
Challengetext.CHAnimalSaleSuccess: You have donated your %s to another facility in exchange for their donation of $%s.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDay: The board of directors of the National Animal Association has sent out a request to zoos nationwide. %s Awareness Day is 3 months away and they would like all member zoos to have at least one animal of this species on-site inside that time period. Their promotional campaign will be extensive and if you have one of these animals in your zoo within 3 months, you will benefit not only from increased attendance but also from the $%s cash grant available to all participating members.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDayShort: Have at least one %s in your zoo for %s Awareness Day in 3 months.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDaySuccessShort: %s Awareness Day was a hit! Zoo attendance was booming you received a cash grant.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDaySuccess: Your participation helped make %s Awareness Day an enormous success. Zoo attendance was booming and the cash grant has been deposited to your account.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDayFailureShort: %s Awareness Day has come and gone. Too bad you couldn't participate.
Challengetext.CHAnimalAwarenessDayFailure: %s Awareness Day was an enormous success. Although you did not receive the full benefit by participating, or the cash grant, you did see a small boost to zoo attendance purely due to the increase in the public's perception of zoos in general.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimals:
The Residential Family Society has begun a campaign promoting the benefits of enrichment and stimulation for pre-school children and is making the correlation that captive animals also benefit from enrichment and stimulation in their lives. They have issued a challenge to zoos nationwide to provide their animals with ample enrichment objects and have imposed a 1 month deadline.
Since your zoo is local to their headquarters, they have targeted your facility for extensive publicity. You will need to research 6 new enrichment objects and use them in your exhibits to demonstrate your commitment to animal enrichment.
If you succeed, you will benefit from free publicity and a boost to your attendance. Should you fail to uphold their ideal they will be merciless in their criticism and you will likely see your attendance decrease.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimalsShort: Within 1 month, research 6 new enrichment objects and use them in your exhibits.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimalsSuccessShort: Your attendance increased due to positive press over the quantity of enrichment objects in your zoo.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimalsSuccess: The Residential Family Society was impressed that you were able to provide such a unique assortment of enriching items for your animals. Their words of support for the efforts of your facility were worth more than any advertising that you could have purchased. Your facility has received a notable boost to attendance.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimalsFailureShort: Your attendance suffered due to bad press over the lack of enrichment objects in your zoo.
Challengetext.CHEnrichingAnimalsFailure: The Residential Family Society was disappointed at the lack of enrichment in your facility. Your animals seemed bored and under-stimulated and they felt this to be a poor example of the message that they were communicating. They were brutal in their assessment of your efforts and your facility has definitely seen a drop in attendance as a result.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanions: An internationally funded conservation group has offered to send you an animal on "loan" to allow you to set up a breeding situation. The cost to obtain this %s is $%s. You may keep the animal for 2 months. If you have had a successful breeding in that time, the conservation group will issue a refund for your initial cost and the young animal is yours to keep. Should you fail to have successful breeding, the animal will be returned to its owner and no refunds will be issued. Finally, if the animal meets with misfortune while in your care such that it cannot be returned to its owner, you will be forced to pay a $%s penalty.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsShort: Breed the animal on loan to you within a 2 month period.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsSuccessShort: You successfully bred the animal on loan to your zoo and have a new young animal to show for it. Your fee was refunded.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsSuccess: Congratulations! You have achieved a successful breeding with the animal on loan to you. The loan period has expired but the young animal is yours to keep in your facility. Your initial fee has been refunded
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsFailureShort: You were unable to successfully breen the animal on loan to your zoo. It has been returned to its owner.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsFailure: The loan period has expired and the animal has been returned to its owner. Perhaps a subsequent breeding opportunity will produce better results.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsBadFailureShort: The aniaml on loan to you could not be returned to its owner! You've had to pay a penalty.
Challengetext.CHAnimalCompanionsBadFailure: The animal on loan to you appears to have met with misfortune and is unavailable for return to the owner! Per the terms of your agreement, $%s has been deducted from your account.
Challengetext.CHAnimalRelease: An internationally funded conservation group has offered you an incentive to release suitable endangered animals to the wild in an effort to promote growth among old populations and make new populations of these animals self-sustaining. Their current research project involves the %s. You have been offered $%s to prepare your %s for release to the wild. 20% will be paid upfront and the remainder will be paid when the animal has been collected for its relocation to its natural habitat.
Challengetext.CHAnimalReleaseSuccessShort: Congratulations! You've successfully released your %s to the wild!
Challengetext.CHAnimalReleaseSuccess: Congratulations! You've successfully released your %s to the wild, enhancing the worldwide population growth of this endangered species. The remainder of your $%s fee has been deposited to your account.
Challengetext.CHAnimalReleaseFailureShort: You no longer can support the release of the %s to the wild.
Challengetext.CHAnimalReleaseFailure: Regrettably it appears that your zoo can no longer support the conservation effort for the %s. The conservation group funding the research project is disappointed that you failed to contribute to the effort to promote growth in the natural populations of these animals.
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuest: You've received a tip that the CEO of a prominent and very wealthy corporation is planning to visit your zoo in the upcoming months. You've heard that %s's favorite animal is the %s and the rumor is that if he finds this animal in your zoo it is likely that he will make a generous donation.
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuestShort: Have a %s in your zoo before %s arrives.
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuestSuccessShort: You've received a generous donation from %s because you had his favorite animal!
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuestSuccess: Congratulations! %s was so impressed that you had his favorite animal that he has chosen to make a generous donation of $%s to your zoo.
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuestFailureShort: You've failed to receive a generous donation from %s because you did not have his favorite animal.
Challengetext.CHSpecialGuestFailure: It's too bad that you did not have %s's favorite animal available during his visit. The rumor is that he donated $%s to an alternate facility that featured the %s.
